main event: A circular object, the size of a dime, approached from the north at a high rate of speed, passed overhead, and disappeared to the south in less than a minute.
interesting points: The object had a reddish color and was emitting a fire-like trail from the rear.
The object was observed by a civilian witness and the sheriff of San Bernardino, who were both considered to be good observers.
The sighting occurred on a night with thin, broken clouds.
The controller at the Air Defense Command Center suggested that the sighting was most likely a meteor.
The report mentions that no aircraft were overdue at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a circular object, the size of a dime
witnesses: a civilian and the sheriff of San Bernardino
